columns.text: In this exercise, we will calculate the present value of a 15-year annuity that pays $1,475 monthly with an interest rate of 9% compounded monthly for the first seven years and 6% compounded monthly afterward.

The present value annuity refers to the current value of the annuity based on the discount rate, the period, and the constant payment received. Hence, the formula to compute the present value of an annuity is as follows.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value of an Annuity} &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the cash amount or constant payment\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period
Since to problem provides two different rates throughout the annuity, we will calculate the present value of the annuity separately.

First, let's calculate the present value of the annuity for the first seven years. We will consider the following details:

| Particulars      |        |
|------------------|--------|
| Constant payment | $1,475 |
| Rate             | 9%     |
| Period (years)   | 7      |

Calculate the monthly rate since the interest rate is a monthly compound. Divide the rate by the number of months in a year.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Rate} &=\dfrac{0.09}{12}
\\[10
pt]
&= 0.75\%
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the rate we will consider is 0.75%

Next, let's multiple the period by the number of months in a year.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Period} &= 7\times12
\\[5pt]
&= 84
\end{aligned}$$

Hence, the period is 84.

Next, calculate the present value annuity for the eighth year until the fifteenth year. We will consider the following details:

| Particulars      |        |
|------------------|--------|
| Constant payment | $1,475 |
| Rate             | 6%     |
| Period (years)   | 8      |

Convert the rate to a monthly value since the interest rate compounds monthly. Divide the rate by the number of months in a year. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Rate} &=\dfrac{0.06}{12}
\\[10
pt]
&= 0.50\%
\end{aligned}$$

Hence, the rate we will use is 0.50%.

Next, multiply the period by the number of months in a year to determine the appropriate period to consider in the calculation.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Period} &= 8\times12
\\[5pt]
&= 96
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen above, the period we will use is 96.
Calculate the present value of the earnings from the eighth to the fifteenth year by considering the annuity value as the future value since the calculation is based more than seven years from now.

In this calculation, we will use consider the following details:

| Particulars      |        |
|------------------|--------|
| Future value | $112,240.45 |
| Rate             | 9%     |
| Period (years)   | 7      |

To calculate the present value of the future value, we will utilized the following formula:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV} &=\dfrac{{FV}_{t}}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PV$, which means the present value\
$FV$, which refers to the future value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

Calculate the monthly rate since the interest rate is a monthly compound. Divide the rate by the number of months in a year.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Rate} &=\dfrac{0.09}{12}
\\[10
pt]
&= 0.75\%
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the rate we will consider is 0.75%

Next, let's multiple the period by the number of months in a year.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Period} &= 7\times12
\\[5pt]
&= 84
\end{aligned}$$

Hence, the period is 84.

Finally, to determine the net present value of the 15-year annuity, combine the two present values. Our calculation can be summarized in the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{NPVA} &= {PVA}_{1}+{PV}_{2}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$NPVA$, which refers to the net present value of the annuity\
${PVA}_{1}$, which indicates the present value annuity for the first to seventh year\
${PVA}_{2}$, which represents the present value of the eighth to the fifteenth year

Let's now calculate the net present value of the annuity.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{NPVA} &= \$91,677.10+\$59,919.03 
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$151,596.13}
\end{aligned}$$

**Therefore, based on the calculation, the net present value of the 15-year annuity is $151,596.13.**

To conclude, to determine the present value of a 15-year annuity with two interest rates, we calculated and combined the present value of the who calculation with different rates. As a result of our computation, the net present value of the annuity is $151,596.13.
